title: Graball Landing
listingDescription: Fourteen-year-old Emmett Till’s body was found near Graball Landing on the Tallahatchie River following his lynching by two White men in 1955.

images.altText: View of a muddy river and opposite forested bank through trees.
images.title: Graball Landing
images.caption: Graball Landing in Glendora, MS.

relatedParks.fullName: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument
relatedParks.name: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley

bodyText:
Fourteen-year-old Emmett Till’s body was found near Graball Landing on the Tallahatchie River following his lynching by two White men in 1955. Graball Landing is located near Glendora, Mississippi, and accessible to visitors via River Road. Please note that River Road is unpaved and can be difficult to traverse in wet conditions. The site includes views of the river, a historic marker, and limited roadside parking. Please respect private property around the site.

Ask about road conditions at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center before visiting. Get directions to the site.

quickFacts.value: Fourteen-year-old Emmett Till’s body was found near Graball Landing on the Tallahatchie River following his lynching by two White men in 1955.
quickFacts.name: Significance

title: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ
listingDescription: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ on Chicago’s South Side was the location of Emmett Till’s funeral in September 1955.

images.credit: Battiest Photography / National Trust for Historic Preservation
images.altText: A multi-story tan brick church along a road. A tree stands in front.
images.title: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ
images.caption: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ in Chicago.

relatedParks.fullName: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument
relatedParks.name: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley

bodyText:
Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ on Chicago’s South Side was the location of Emmett Till’s funeral in September 1955. It is still an active church today. Public access is limited to the exterior of the building. Please respect the private property of the church. Visitor information is located at Pullman National Historical Park 11 miles to the south. A Passport to Your National Parks® cancellation stamp for the Illinois unit is available at the Pullman National Historical Park Administration Clock Tower Building Visitor Center.

Get directions to Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ.
managedByOrg: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ

quickFacts.value: Roberts Temple Church of God in Christ on Chicago’s South Side was the location of Emmett Till’s funeral in September 1955.
quickFacts.name: Significance

title: Tallahatchie County Courthouse and Emmett Till Interpretive Center
listingDescription: The trial of the men accused of lynching Emmett Till took place at the Tallahatchie County Courthouse in Sumner, Mississippi. Visitors can learn more at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center, an official nonprofit partner of Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument, across the street from the courthouse.

images.altText: Front of a two-story brick courthouse with a clock tower. A tree stands in front.
images.title: Tallahatchie County Courthouse
images.caption: The Tallahatchie County Courthouse in Sumner, MS.

relatedParks.fullName: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument
relatedParks.name: Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley

bodyText: The trial of the men accused of lynching Emmett Till took place at the Tallahatchie County Courthouse in Sumner, Mississippi. Visitors can learn more at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center, an official nonprofit partner of Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument, across the street from the courthouse. Tours of the courthouse begin at the center. While at the center, experience local efforts to support community healing through art and storytelling. The center also offers a self-guided tour app of other sites related to Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley. A Passport to Your National Parks® cancellation stamp for the Mississippi unit is available at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center. Please respect private property as you visit the area. Get directions to the site.
passportStampLocationDescription: A Passport to Your National Parks® cancellation stamp for the Mississippi unit of Emmett Till and Mamie Till-Mobley National Monument is available at the Emmett Till Interpretive Center in Sumner.
